00019 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00020 //! \defgroup usb_std USB standard definitions
00021 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00022 
00023 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00024 //! \ingroup usb_std 
00025 //! \brief Standard Device Requests
00026 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 //! \details These are the standard request defined for a SETUP transaction. Please refer
00028 //! to Section 9.4 of the USB 2.0 specification for more information. 
00029 //! Table 9.4 defines the bRequest values for each request.
00030 //! \see S_usb_request
00031 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.4
00032 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 enum EnumStandardDeviceRequests // Standard Device Requests
00034 {
00035     USB_GET_STATUS         = 0x00, //!< Returns the status for the specified recipient.
00036                                    //!< \see get_status_const
00037                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.5
00038     USB_CLEAR_FEATURE      = 0x01, //!< Disables a specific feature of the device
00039                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.1
00040                                    //!< \see EnumStandardFeature
00041     USB_RESERVED_REQ02     = 0x02, //!< Reserved for future use
00042     USB_SET_FEATURE        = 0x03, //!< Enables a specific feature of the device
00043                                    //!< \see EnumStandardFeature
00044                                    //!< \see set_feat_const
00045                                    //!< \see_usb20 - 9.4.9
00046     USB_RESERVED_REQ04     = 0x04, //!< Reserved for future use
00047     USB_SET_ADDRESS        = 0x05, //!< Sets the device address for subsequent accesses
00048                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.6
00049     USB_GET_DESCRIPTOR     = 0x06, //!< Returns the specified descriptor if it exists
00050                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.3
00051     USB_SET_DESCRIPTOR     = 0x07, //!< Updates existing descriptors or creates new 
00052                                    //!< descriptors. This request is optional.
00053                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.8
00054     USB_GET_CONFIGURATION  = 0x08, //!< Returns the current configuration value of the 
00055                                    //!< device.
00056                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.2
00057     USB_SET_CONFIGURATION  = 0x09, //!< Sets the configuration of the device
00058                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.7
00059     USB_GET_INTERFACE      = 0x0A, //!< Returns the specified alternate setting for an 
00060                                    //!< interface.
00061                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.4
00062     USB_SET_INTERFACE      = 0x0B, //!< Selects an alternate setting for the selected 
00063                                    //!< interface.
00064                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.10
00065     USB_SYNCH_FRAME        = 0x0C  //!< Sets and reports an endpoint synchronization frame
00066                                    //!< \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.11
00067 };
00068 
00069 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00070 //! \ingroup usb_std 
00071 //! \brief Clear/Set Feature - Constants
00072 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00073 //! \details Useful constants when declaring a Clear Feature or Set Feature
00074 //! standard request.
00075 //! \see EnumStandardDeviceRequests
00076 //! \see S_usb_request
00077 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.4 - Table 9.6
00078 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00079 enum EnumStandardFeature //!< Standard Feature Selectors
00080 {
00081     //! Possible values for the wValue field of the Clear Feature and Set Feature
00082     //! standard requests.
00083     //
00084     USB_ENDPOINT_HALT         = 0x00, //!< Halt feature of an endpoint
00085     USB_DEVICE_REMOTE_WAKEUP  = 0x01, //!< Remote wake-up feature of the device
00086     USB_TEST_MODE             = 0x02  //!< USB test mode
00087 };
00088 
00089 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 //! \brief Set Feature - Constants
00091 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00092 //! \details Useful constants when declaring a Set Feature standard request
00093 //! \see_usb20 - Section 7.1.20
00094 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.2.9 - Table 9.7
00095 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00096 enum EnumTestMode //!< Test Mode Selectors
00097 {
00098     //! Test modes available to probe an USB device.
00099     //
00100     TEST_J             = 0x01, //!< Tests the high-output drive level on the D+ line
00101     TEST_K             = 0x02, //!< Tests the high-output drive level on the D- line
00102     TEST_SEO_NAK       = 0x03, //!< Tests the output impedance, low-level output voltage 
00103                                //!< and loading characteristics
00104     TEST_PACKET        = 0x04, //!< Tests rise and fall times, eye patterns and jitter
00105     TEST_FORCE_ENABLE  = 0x05  //!< Tests the hub disconnect detection
00106 };
00107 
00108 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109 //! \ingroup usb_std
00110 //! \brief Get/Set Descriptor - Constants
00111 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00112 //! \details Useful constants when declaring a Get Descriptor or Set Descriptor
00113 //! standard request
00114 //! \see S_usb_device_descriptor
00115 //! \see S_usb_configuration_descriptor
00116 //! \see S_usb_endpoint_descriptor
00117 //! \see S_usb_device_qualifier_descriptor
00118 //! \see S_USB_LANGUAGE_ENGLISH_US
00119 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.5 - Table 9.5
00120 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00121 enum EnumDescriptorType //! Descriptor Types
00122 {
00123     //! Possible bDescriptorType values for the descriptor structures.
00124     //! They can be used with Get Descriptor and Set Descriptor standard requests
00125     //! to retrieve/modify them
00126     //
00127     USB_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR                     = 0x01, //!< Device descriptor
00128     USB_CONFIGURATION_DESCRIPTOR              = 0x02, //!< Configuration descriptor
00129     USB_STRING_DESCRIPTOR                     = 0x03, //!< String descriptor
00130     USB_INTERFACE_DESCRIPTOR                  = 0x04, //!< Interface descriptor
00131     USB_ENDPOINT_DESCRIPTOR                   = 0x05, //!< Endpoint descriptor
00132     USB_DEVICE_QUALIFIER_DESCRIPTOR           = 0x06, //!< Device qualifier descriptor
00133     USB_OTHER_SPEED_CONFIGURATION_DESCRIPTOR  = 0x07, //!< Other speed configuration 
00134                                                       //!< descriptor
00135     USB_INTERFACE_POWER_DESCRIPTOR            = 0x08  //!< Interface power descriptor
00136 };
00137 
00138 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00139 //! \ingroup usb_std
00140 //! \brief Endpoint Descriptor - Constants
00141 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142 //! \details Useful constants when declaring an endpoint descriptor
00143 //! \see S_usb_endpoint_descriptor
00144 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.6 - Table 9.13
00145 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00146 
00147 enum EnumEndpointAddress //!< bEndpointAddress field
00148 {
00149     //!< Values for the bEndpointAddress field of an endpoint descriptor.
00150     //
00151     USB_ENDPOINT_OUT    = (0 << 7), //!< Defines an OUT endpoint
00152     USB_ENDPOINT_IN     = (1 << 7)  //!< Defines an IN endpoint
00153 };
00154 
00155 enum EnumEndpointAttribute //!< bmAttributes field
00156 {
00157     //! These are the four possible tranfer type values for the bmAttributes
00158     //! field of an endpoint descriptor.
00159     //
00160     ENDPOINT_TYPE_CONTROL        = 0x00, //!< Defines a CONTROL endpoint
00161     ENDPOINT_TYPE_ISOCHRONOUS    = 0x01, //!< Defines a ISOCHRONOUS endpoint
00162     ENDPOINT_TYPE_BULK           = 0x02, //!< Defines a BULK endpoint
00163     ENDPOINT_TYPE_INTERRUPT      = 0x03  //!< Defines an INTERRUPT endpoint
00164 };
00165 
00166 //! Get the endpoint type from bmAttributes field
00167 #define USB_ENDPOINT_TYPE(bmAttributes)  ( (bmAttributes) & 0x03 )
00168 
00169 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00170 //! \ingroup usb_std
00171 //! \brief bmRequestType bitmapped field identifies the characteristics of the specific 
00172 //! request.
00173 //! \see_usb20 - Table 9-2. Format of Setup Data
00174 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00175 
00176 enum EnumEndpointDirType //!< bmRequestType field -- bit [7]: Data transfer direction
00177 {
00178     USB_DIR_HOST2DEVICE      = 0x00, //!< Host to device data transfer direction
00179     USB_DIR_DEVICE2HOST      = 0x01, //!< Host to device data transfer direction
00180 };
00181 
00182 enum EnumEndpointReqType //!< bmRequestType field -- bits [6..5]: Type of the request
00183 {
00184     USB_STANDARD_REQUEST     = 0x00, //!< Defines a standard request
00185     USB_CLASS_REQUEST        = 0x01, //!< Defines a class request
00186     USB_VENDOR_REQUEST       = 0x02  //!< Defines a vendor request
00187 };
00188 
00189 enum EnumEndpointRecipient //!< bmRequestType field -- bits [4..0]: Recipient
00190 {
00191     USB_RECIPIENT_DEVICE     = 0x00, //!< Recipient is the whole device
00192     USB_RECIPIENT_INTERFACE  = 0x01, //!< Recipient is an interface
00193     USB_RECIPIENT_ENDPOINT   = 0x02  //!< Recipient is an endpoint
00194 };
00195 
00196 //! Get the type of the request bits [6..5] from the bmRequestType
00197 #define USB_REQUEST_TYPE(reqType)       ( (reqType) & = 0x60) >> 5 )
00198 
00199 //! Get the receipient bits [4..0] from the bmRequestType
00200 #define USB_REQUEST_RECIPIENT(reqType)  ( (reqType) &= 0x1F )
00201 
00202 //! Get the data transfer direction bits [4..0] from the bmRequestType
00203 #define USB_REQUEST_DIR(reqType)  ( ( (reqType) &= 0x80 ) >> 7 )
00204 
00205 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00206 //! \ingroup usb_std
00207 //! \brief Endpoint Descriptor - Macros
00208 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00209 //! \details Useful macros when declaring an endpoint descriptor
00210 //! \see S_usb_endpoint_descriptor
00211 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.6 - Table 9.13
00212 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00213 
00214 //! bEndpointAddress field macros
00215 
00216 //! Returns an endpoint number
00217 #define USB_ENDPOINT_NUMBER(bEndpointAddress)    ( (bEndpointAddress) & 0x0F )
00218 
00219 //! Returns an endpoint direction (IN or OUT)
00220 #define USB_ENDPOINT_DIRECTION(bEndpointAddress) ( (bEndpointAddress) & 0x80 )
00221 
00222 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00223 //! USB Class Codes
00224 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00225 //! These are the class codes approved by the USB-IF organization. They can be
00226 //! used for the bDeviceClass value of a device descriptor, or the
00227 //! bInterfaceClass value of an interface descriptor.
00228 //! \see S_usb_device_descriptor
00229 //! \see S_usb_interface_descriptor
00230 //! \see http://www.usb.org/developers/defined_class
00231 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00232 enum EnumUsbClassCodes //!< USB Class Codes
00233 {
00234     USB_CLASS_DEVICE                = 0x00, //!< Indicates that the class information is 
00235                                             //!< determined by the interface descriptor.
00236     USB_CLASS_AUDIO                 = 0x01, //!< Audio capable devices
00237     USB_CLASS_COMMUNICATION         = 0x02, //!< Communication devices
00238     USB_CLASS_HID                   = 0x03, //!< Human-interface devices
00239     USB_CLASS_PHYSICAL              = 0x05, //!< Human-interface devices requiring 
00240                                             //!< real-time physical feedback
00241     USB_CLASS_STILL_IMAGING         = 0x06, //!< Still image capture devices
00242     USB_CLASS_PRINTER               = 0x07, //!< Printer devices
00243     USB_CLASS_MASS_STORAGE          = 0x08, //!< Mass-storage devices
00244     USB_CLASS_HUB                   = 0x09, //!< Hub devices
00245     USB_CLASS_CDC_DATA              = 0x0A, //!< Raw-data communication device
00246     USB_CLASS_SMARTCARDS            = 0x0B, //!< Smartcards devices
00247     USB_CLASS_CONTENT_SECURITY      = 0x0D, //!< Protected content devices
00248     USB_CLASS_VIDEO                 = 0x0E, //!< Video recording devices
00249     USB_CLASS_DIAGNOSTIC_DEVICE     = 0xDC, //!< Devices that diagnostic devices
00250     USB_CLASS_WIRELESS_CONTROLLER   = 0xE0, //!< Wireless controller devices
00251     USB_CLASS_MISCELLANEOUS         = 0xEF, //!< Miscellaneous devices
00252     USB_CLASS_APPLICATION_SPECIFIC  = 0xFE, //!< Application-specific class code
00253     USB_CLASS_VENDOR_SPECIFIC       = 0xFF  //!< Vendor-specific class code
00254 };

00282     //!< S_usb_configuration_descriptor.

00322 //! characters in it

00325 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00326 //! Standard return values
00327 //! \brief Values returned by the usb device driver API methods.
00328 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00329 enum EnumStandardReturnValue //!< Standard return values
00330 {
00331     USB_STATUS_SUCCESS      = 0, //!< Last method has completed successfully
00332     USB_STATUS_LOCKED       = 1, //!< Method was aborted because the recipient 
00333                                  //!< (device, endpoint, ...) was busy
00334     USB_STATUS_ABORTED      = 2, //!< Method was aborted because of abnormal status
00335     USB_STATUS_RESET        = 3, //!< Method was aborted because the endpoint or the 
00336                                  //!< device has been reset
00337     USB_STATUS_IMMEDREAD    = 4, //!< Immediate read. Passed to the CUsbDriver::Read()'s 
00338                                  //!< callback in case that data was already in FIFO
00339                                  //!< when Read() was posted.
00340 };
00341 
00342 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00343 //! USB Device States
00344 //! \brief Constant values used to track which USB state the device is currently in.
00345 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00346 enum EnumUsbDeviceStates //!< USB Device States
00347 {
00348     USB_STATE_ATTACHED      = (1 << 0), //!< Attached state
00349     USB_STATE_POWERED       = (1 << 1), //!< Powered state
00350     USB_STATE_DEFAULT       = (1 << 2), //!< Default state
00351     USB_STATE_ADDRESS       = (1 << 3), //!< Address state
00352     USB_STATE_CONFIGURED    = (1 << 4), //!< Configured state
00353     USB_STATE_SUSPENDED     = (1 << 5)  //!< Suspended state
00354 };

00356 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00357 //!      USB Standard Structures
00358 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00359 
00360 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00361 //! USB standard structures
00362 //! \brief Chapter 9 of the USB specification 2.0 (usb_20.pdf) describes a
00363 //!        standard USB device framework. Several structures and associated
00364 //!        constants have been defined on that model and are described here.
00365 //! \see   usb_20.pdf - Section 9
00366 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00367 
00368 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00369 //! \brief This structure represents a standard SETUP request
00370 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.3 - Table 9.2
00371 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00372 struct S_usb_request
00373 {
00374     uchar   bmRequestType :  8; //!< Characteristics of the request
00375     uchar   bRequest      :  8; //!< Particular request
00376     ushort  wValue        : 16; //!< Request-specific parameter
00377     ushort  wIndex        : 16; //!< Request-specific parameter
00378     ushort  wLength       : 16; //!< Length of data for the data phase
00379 
00380 } ATTR_PACKED;
00381 
00382 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00383 //! \brief This descriptor structure is used to provide information on
00384 //!        various parameters of the device
00385 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.1
00386 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00387 struct S_usb_device_descriptor
00388 {
00389    uchar  bLength;              //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00390    uchar  bDescriptorType;      //!< DEVICE descriptor type
00391    ushort bscUSB;               //!< USB specification release number
00392    uchar  bDeviceClass;         //!< Class code
00393    uchar  bDeviceSubClass;      //!< Subclass code
00394    uchar  bDeviceProtocol;      //!< Protocol code
00395    uchar  bMaxPacketSize0;      //!< Control endpoint 0 max. packet size
00396    ushort idVendor;             //!< Vendor ID
00397    ushort idProduct;            //!< Product ID
00398    ushort bcdDevice;            //!< Device release number
00399    uchar  iManufacturer;        //!< Index of manufacturer string descriptor
00400    uchar  iProduct;             //!< Index of produdct string descriptor
00401    uchar  iSerialNumber;        //!< Index of serial number string descriptor
00402    uchar  bNumConfigurations;   //!< Number of possible configurations
00403 
00404 } ATTR_PACKED;
00405 
00406 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00407 //! \brief This is the standard configuration descriptor structure. It is used
00408 //!        to report the current configuration of the device.
00409 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.3
00410 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00411 struct S_usb_configuration_descriptor
00412 {
00413    uchar  bLength;              //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00414    uchar  bDescriptorType;      //!< CONFIGURATION descriptor type
00415    ushort wTotalLength;         //!< Total length of data returned for this configuration
00416    uchar  bNumInterfaces;       //!< Number of interfaces for this
00417                                 //!< configuration
00418    uchar  bConfigurationValue;  //!< Value to use as an argument for the Set Configuration 
00419                                 //!< request to select this configuration
00420    uchar  iConfiguration;       //!< Index of string descriptor describing this 
00421                                 //!< configuration
00422    uchar  bmAttibutes;          //!< Configuration characteristics
00423    uchar  bMaxPower;            //!< Maximum power consumption of the device
00424 
00425 } ATTR_PACKED;
00426 
00427 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00428 //! \brief Standard interface descriptor. Used to describe a specific interface
00429 //!        of a configuration.
00430 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.5
00431 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00432 struct S_usb_interface_descriptor
00433 {
00434    uchar bLength;               //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00435    uchar bDescriptorType;       //!< INTERFACE descriptor type
00436    uchar bInterfaceNumber;      //!< Number of this interface
00437    uchar bAlternateSetting;     //!< Value used to select this alternate setting
00438    uchar bNumEndpoints;         //!< Number of endpoints used by this interface 
00439                                 //!< (excluding endpoint zero)
00440    uchar bInterfaceClass;       //!< Class code
00441    uchar bInterfaceSubClass;    //!< Sub-class
00442    uchar bInterfaceProtocol;    //!< Protocol code
00443    uchar iInterface;            //!< Index of string descriptor describing this interface
00444 
00445 } ATTR_PACKED;
00446 
00447 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00448 //! \brief This structure is the standard endpoint descriptor. It contains
00449 //!        the necessary information for the host to determine the bandwidth
00450 //!        required by the endpoint.
00451 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.6
00452 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00453 struct S_usb_endpoint_descriptor
00454 {
00455    uchar  bLength;              //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00456    uchar  bDescriptorType;      //!< ENDPOINT descriptor type
00457    uchar  bEndpointAddress;     //!< Address of the endpoint on the USB device described
00458                                 //!< this descriptor
00459    uchar  bmAttributes;         //!< Endpoint attributes when configured
00460    ushort wMaxPacketSize;       //!< Maximum packet size this endpoint is capable of 
00461                                 //!< sending or receiving
00462    uchar  bInterval;            //!< Interval for polling endpoint fordata transfers
00463 
00464 } ATTR_PACKED;
00465 
00466 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00467 //! \brief The device qualifier structure provide information on a high-speed
00468 //!        capable device if the device was operating at the other speed.
00469 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.2
00470 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00471 struct S_usb_device_qualifier_descriptor
00472 {
00473    uchar  bLength;              //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00474    uchar  bDescriptorType;      //!< DEVICE_QUALIFIER descriptor type
00475    ushort bscUSB;               //!< USB specification release number
00476    uchar  bDeviceClass;         //!< Class code
00477    uchar  bDeviceSubClass;      //!< Sub-class code
00478    uchar  bDeviceProtocol;      //!< Protocol code
00479    uchar  bMaxPacketSize0;      //!< Control endpoint 0 max. packet size
00480    uchar  bNumConfigurations;   //!< Number of possible configurations
00481    uchar  bReserved;            //!< Reserved for future use, must be 0
00482 
00483 } ATTR_PACKED;
00484 
00485 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00486 //! \brief The S_usb_language_id structure represents the string descriptor
00487 //!        zero, used to specify the languages supported by the device. This
00488 //!        structure only define one language ID.
00489 //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.6.7 - Table 9.15
00490 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00491 struct S_usb_language_id
00492 {
00493    uchar  bLength;              //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00494    uchar  bDescriptorType;      //!< STRING descriptor type
00495    ushort wLANGID;              //!< LANGID code zero
00496 
00497 } ATTR_PACKED;
00498 
00499 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00500 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00501 // USB Framework
00502 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00503 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00504 
00505 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00506 //! \brief Abstract class that declares various event sinks (callbacks) called by the USB 
00507 //!        low-level driver. These callback functions are used by the USB API 
00508 //!        to notify the user application of incoming events or actions to perform.
00509 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00510 class CEventSink 
00511 {
00512 public:
00513 
00514     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00515     // METHODS
00516     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00517 
00518     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00519     // Pure Virtual Methods (callbacks are originated in CUsbDriver)
00520     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00521 
00522     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00523     //! \brief Callback API (usb_api_callbacks)
00524     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00525     //! \details These callback functions are used by the USB API to notify the
00526     //!        user application of incoming events or actions to perform.
00527     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00528 
00529     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00530     //! \brief Initialization callback function
00531     //! \details This callback is invoked whenever the USB API is initialized using the
00532     //! CUsbDriver::Init function. It should perform the following operations:
00533     //!  -#  If an OS is being used, install the USB driver
00534     //!  -#  Configure the USB controller interrupt
00535     //!  -#  Configure the VBus monitoring interrupt
00536     //! Attention: Implementation of this callback is mandatory
00537     //! \see CUsbDriver::Init
00538     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00539     virtual void OnInit( void ) = 0;
00540 
00541     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00542     //! \brief Reset callback function
00543     //! \details Invoked whenever the device is reset by the host. This function should
00544     //! perform initialization or re-initialization of the user application.
00545     //! Attention: Implementation of this callback is optional
00546     //! \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00547     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00548     virtual void OnReset( void ) = 0;
00549 
00550     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00551     //! \brief Suspend callback function
00552     //! \details Invoked when the device is suspended by the host or detached from the bus.
00553     //! If the device must enter low-power mode when suspended, then the necessary
00554     //! code must be implemented here.
00555     //! \see CUsbDriver::Attach
00556     //! \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00557     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00558     virtual void OnSuspend( void ) = 0;
00559     
00560     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00561     //! \brief Resume callback function
00562     //! \details Invoked when the device is resumed by the host or attached to the bus.
00563     //! If the suspend callback has put the device into low-power mode, then this
00564     //! function must perform the necessary actions to return it to a normal mode of
00565     //! operation.
00566     //! \see CEventSink::OnSuspend
00567     //! \see CUsbDriver::Attach
00568     //! \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00569     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00570     virtual void OnResume( void ) = 0;
00571 
00572     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00573     //! \brief New Request callback function
00574     //! \details Invoked when a new SETUP request is received. The request can then be
00575     //! retrieved by using the GetSetup function on the CUsbDriver instance.
00576     //! \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00577     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00578     virtual void OnNewRequest( void ) = 0;
00579 
00580     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00581     //! \brief  Interrupt SOF callback function
00582     //!         Invoked when a SOF interrupt is received.
00583     //! \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00584     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00585     virtual void OnStartOfFrame( void ) = 0;
00586 };
00587 
00588 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00589 //! \brief Abstract class that declares board specific control of D+ pull up and 
00590 //!        VBUS detection.
00591 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00592 class CBoard
00593 {
00594 public:
00595 
00596     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00597     //! \brief   Indicates the state of the VBus power line associated with the
00598     //!          specified interface.
00599     //! \return  true if VBus is detected, false otherwise
00600     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00601     virtual bool IsVBusConnected( void ) = 0;
00602 
00603     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00604     //! \brief   Enables the external pull-up on D+ associated with the specified
00605     //!          USB controller
00606     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00607     virtual void ConnectPullUp( void ) = 0;
00608 
00609     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00610     //! \brief   Disables the external pull-up on D+ associated with the specified
00611     //!          USB controller
00612     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00613     virtual void DisconnectPullUp( void ) = 0;
00614 
00615     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00616     //! \brief   Indicates the state of the external pull-up associated with the
00617     //!          specified interface.
00618     //! \return  true if the pull-up is currently connected, false otherwise.
00619     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00620     virtual bool IsPullUpConnected( void ) = 0;
00621 
00622     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00623     //! \brief   Configures the external pull-up on the D+ line associated with
00624     //!          the specified USB controller.
00625     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00626     virtual void ConfigurePullUp( void ) = 0;
00627 
00628     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00629     //! \brief   Configures the VBus monitoring PIO associated with the specified
00630     //!          USB controller.
00631     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00632     virtual void ConfigureVBus( void ) = 0;
00633 };
00634 
00635 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00636 //! \brief This class is used to track the current status of an endpoint,
00637 //!        i.e. the current transfer descriptors, the number of FIFO banks used,
00638 //!        and so forth.
00639 //! \details Each endpoint used by the firmware must have a corresponding CEndpoint
00640 //! object instance associated with it.
00641 //! \see CUsbDriver
00642 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00643 class CEndpoint
00644 {
00645 public:    
00646     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00647     //      Types
00648     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00649     
00650     enum STATE //!< Endpoint State Machine
00651     {
00652         StateDisabled = 0,
00653         StateIdle     = 1,
00654         StateWrite    = 2,
00655         StateRead     = 3,
00656         StateHalted   = 4
00657     };
00658 
00659     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00660     // Transfer Descriptor
00661     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00662     uchar*        pData;             //!< Transfer descriptor pointer to a 
00663                                      //!< buffer where the data is read/stored
00664     uchar*        pDataLowerBound;   //!< Circular buffer lower bound; pData >= lower bound
00665     uchar*        pDataUpperBound;   //!< Circular buffer upper bound; pData < upper bound
00666     uint          dBytesRemaining;   //!< Number of remaining bytes to transfer
00667     uint          dBytesBuffered;    //!< Number of bytes which have been buffered
00668                                      //!< but not yet transferred
00669     uint          dBytesTransferred; //!< Number of bytes transferred for the 
00670                                      //!< current operation
00671     bool          bCompletePacket;   //!< Send End-of-packet after sending 
00672                                      //!< data that was multiple of wMaxPacketSize.
00673                                      //!< If false next Write will continue the same packet.
00674     Callback_f    fCallback;         //!< Callback to invoke after the current 
00675                                      //!< transfer is complete
00676     void*         pArgument;         //!< Argument to pass to the callback function
00677 
00678     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00679     // Hardware Information
00680     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00681     uint          wMaxPacketSize;    //!< Maximum packet size for this endpoint
00682     uint          dFlag;             //!< Hardware flag to clear upon data reception
00683     uint          dNumFIFO;          //!< Number of FIFO buffers defined for this endpoint
00684     volatile uint dState;            //!< Endpoint internal state
00685     
00686     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00687     //! \brief Initialize endpoint with single/dualbank.
00688     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00689     CEndpoint( void )
00690     {
00691         TRACE_INFO( "CEndpoint %08x\n", uint( this ) );
00692 
00693         pData             = 0;
00694         pDataLowerBound   = 0;
00695         pDataUpperBound   = 0;
00696         dBytesRemaining   = 0;
00697         dBytesBuffered    = 0;
00698         dBytesTransferred = 0;
00699         bCompletePacket   = true;
00700         fCallback         = 0;
00701         pArgument         = 0;
00702         wMaxPacketSize    = 0;
00703         dFlag             = 0;
00704         dNumFIFO          = 0;
00705         dState            = StateDisabled;
00706     }
00707     
00708     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00709     //! \brief Initialize endpoint with single/dualbank.
00710     //! \param numFIFO  number of FIFO buffers: 1 for singlebank, 2 for dualbank
00711     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00712     void Init( int numFIFO )
00713     {
00714         dNumFIFO = numFIFO;
00715     }
00716     
00717     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00718     //! \brief  Invokes the callback associated with a finished transfer on an
00719     //!         endpoint
00720     //! \param  bStatus   Status code returned by the transfer operation
00721     //! \see    Status codes
00722     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00723     void EndOfTransfer( int bStatus )
00724     {
00725         if ( dState == CEndpoint::StateWrite || dState == CEndpoint::StateRead )
00726         {
00727             TRACE_DEBUG_L( "EoT " );
00728 
00729             //! Endpoint returns in Idle state
00730             //
00731             dState = CEndpoint::StateIdle;
00732 
00733             //! Invoke callback is present
00734             //
00735             if ( fCallback != 0 ) 
00736             {
00737                 fCallback
00738                 (
00739                      uint( pArgument ),
00740                      uint( bStatus ),
00741                      dBytesTransferred,
00742                      dBytesRemaining + dBytesBuffered
00743                      );
00744             }
00745         }
00746     }
00747 };
00748 
00749 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00750 //! \brief Low-level USB device driver abstract class.
00751 //! \details This class is used to provide an abstraction over which USB controller
00752 //! is used by the chip. This means the USB framework is fully portable between
00753 //! AT91 chips and supports chips with more than one controller.
00754 //! The structure holds information about the USB controller used, such as
00755 //! a pointer to the physical address of the peripheral, to the endpoints FIFO, etc.
00756 //! In most case, it is not necessary to declare a CUsbDriver instance: the
00757 //! defaultDriver global variable can be used. This is not possible for chips
00758 //! which have more than one USB controller in them, where each controller must
00759 //! have separate CUsbDriver instance.
00760 //! \see CEventSink
00761 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00762 class CUsbDriver
00763 {
00764 protected:
00765 
00766     CEventSink*       pEventSink;      //!< Pointer to associated CEventSink instance
00767     CBoard*           pBoard;          //!< Pointer to associated CBoard instance
00768     CEndpoint*        pEndpoints;      //!< Endpoints list
00769     int               dNumEndpoints;   //!< Number of endpoints in list
00770     S_usb_request     sSetup;          //!< Pointer to the last received SETUP packet
00771     volatile uint     dState;          //!< Current state of the device
00772     bool              useSOFCallback;  //!< Indicates wether to forward StartOfFrame events
00773 
00774     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00775     //! \brief  Constructor. Just nullify/disable everything.
00776     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00777     CUsbDriver( void )
00778     {
00779         TRACE_INFO( "CUsbDriver %08x\n", uint( this ) );
00780 
00781         pEventSink     = 0;
00782         pBoard         = 0;
00783         pEndpoints     = 0;
00784         dNumEndpoints  = 0;
00785         dState         = 0;
00786         useSOFCallback = false;
00787     }
00788     
00789     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00790     //! \brief  Set flag(s) in dStatus register
00791     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00792     void SetState( uint flags )
00793     {
00794         dState |= flags;
00795     }
00796     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00797     //! \brief  Clear flag(s) in dStatus register.
00798     //!         If the method is called without arguments, it will set dState to 0.
00799     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00800     void ClearState( uint flags = 0xFFFF )
00801     {
00802         dState &= ~flags;
00803     }
00804 
00805 public:
00806     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00807     //      Pure Virtual Methods
00808     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00809 
00810     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00811     //! \brief USB API Methods
00812     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00813     //! \details Methods provided by the USB API to manipulate a USB driver.
00814     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00815 
00816     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00817     //! \brief  Returns a pointer to the UDP controller interface used by an USB
00818     //!         driver. The pointer is cast to the correct type (AT91PS_UDP).
00819     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00820     virtual void* GetInterface( void ) = 0;
00821     
00822     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00823     //! \brief  Returns the USB controller peripheral ID of a CUsbDriver instance.
00824     //! \return USB controller peripheral ID
00825     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00826     virtual uint GetDriverID( void ) = 0;
00827     
00828     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00829     //! \brief  Initializes the USB API and the USB controller.
00830     //! \details This method must be called prior to using an other USB method. Before
00831     //! finishing, it invokes the CEventSink::OnInit callback.
00832     //! \see    CEventSink::OnInit
00833     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00834     virtual void Init( void ) = 0;
00835 
00836     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00837     //! \brief  Sends data through an USB endpoint.
00838     //! \details This method sends the specified amount of data through a particular
00839     //! endpoint. The transfer finishes either when the data has been completely
00840     //! sent, or an abnormal condition causes the API to abort this operation.
00841     //! An optional user-provided callback can be invoked once the transfer is
00842     //! complete.
00843     //! On control endpoints, this function automatically send a Zero-Length Packet
00844     //! (ZLP) if the data payload size is a multiple of the endpoint maximum packet
00845     //! size. This is not the case for bulk, interrupt or isochronous endpoints.
00846     //! \param  bEndpoint Number of the endpoint through which to send the data
00847     //! \param  pData     Pointer to a buffer containing the data to send
00848     //! \param  dLength   Size of the data buffer
00849     //! \param  fCallback Callback function to invoke when the transfer finishes
00850     //! \param  pArgument Optional parameter to pass to the callback function
00851     //! \param  pDataLowerBound Lower bound of the circular buffer
00852     //! \param  pDataUpperBound Upper bound of the circular buffer
00853     //! \return Result of operation
00854     //! \see    EnumStandardReturnValue
00855     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00856     virtual EnumStandardReturnValue Write
00857     ( 
00858         int bEndpoint,
00859         const void* pData, uint dLength,
00860         Callback_f fCallback = 0, void* pArgument = 0,
00861         const void* pDataLowerBound = 0, const void* pDataUpperBound = 0
00862         ) = 0;
00863 
00864     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00865     //! \brief  Receives data on the specified USB endpoint.
00866     //! \details This functions receives data on a particular endpoint. It finishes either
00867     //! when the provided buffer is full, when a short packet (payload size inferior
00868     //! to the endpoint maximum packet size) is received, or if an abnormal
00869     //! condition causes a transfer abort. An optional user-provided callback can be
00870     //! invoked upon the transfer completion
00871     //! \param  bEndpoint Number of the endpoint on which to receive the data
00872     //! \param  pData     Pointer to the buffer in which to store the received data
00873     //! \param  dLength   Size of the receive buffer
00874     //! \param  fCallback Optional user-provided callback function invoked upon the
00875     //!                   transfer completion
00876     //! \param  pArgument Optional parameter to pass to the callback function
00877     //! \return Result of operation
00878     //! \see    EnumStandardReturnValue
00879     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00880     virtual EnumStandardReturnValue Read
00881     (
00882         int bEndpoint,
00883         void* pData, uint dLength,
00884         Callback_f fCallback = 0, void* pArgument = 0
00885         ) = 0;
00886 
00887     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00888     //! \brief  Sends a STALL handshake for the next received packet.
00889     //! \details This function only send one STALL handshake, and only if the next packet
00890     //! is not a SETUP packet (when using this function on a control endpoint).
00891     //! \param  bEndpoint Number of endpoint on which to send the STALL
00892     //! \return Result of operation
00893     //! \see    EnumStandardReturnValue
00894     //! \see    CUsbDriver::Halt
00895     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00896     virtual EnumStandardReturnValue Stall( int bEndpoint = 0 ) = 0;
00897 
00898     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00899     //! \brief  Clears, sets or retrieves the halt state of the specified endpoint.
00900     //! \details While an endpoint is in Halt state, it acknowledges every received packet
00901     //! with a STALL handshake.
00902     //! \param  bEndpoint Number of the endpoint to alter
00903     //! \param  bRequest  The operation to perform (set, clear or get)
00904     //! \return true if the endpoint is halted, false otherwise
00905     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00906     virtual bool Halt( int bEndpoint, int bRequest ) = 0;
00907 
00908     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00909     //! \brief  Starts a remote wakeup procedure
00910     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00911     virtual void RemoteWakeUp( void ) = 0;
00912 
00913     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00914     //! \brief  Configures the specified endpoint using the provided endpoint
00915     //!         descriptor.
00916     //! \details An endpoint must be configured prior to being used. This is not necessary
00917     //! for control endpoint 0, as this operation is automatically performed during
00918     //! initialization.
00919     //! \param  pEpDesc Pointer to an endpoint descriptor
00920     //! \return true if the endpoint has been configured, false otherwise
00921     //! \see    S_usb_endpoint_descriptor
00922     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00923     virtual bool ConfigureEndpoint( const S_usb_endpoint_descriptor* pEpDesc ) = 0;
00924 
00925     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00926     //! \brief  Handles the attachment or detachment of the device to or from the USB
00927     //! \details This method should be called whenever the VBus power line changes state,
00928     //! i.e. the device becomes powered/unpowered. Alternatively, it can also be
00929     //! called to poll the status of the device.
00930     //! When the device is detached from the bus, the CEventSink::OnSuspend callback is
00931     //! invoked. Conversely, when the device is attached, the CEventSink::OnResume 
00932     //! callback is triggered.
00933     //! \return true if the device is currently attached, false otherwise
00934     //! \see    CEventSink::OnSuspend
00935     //! \see    CEventSink::OnResume
00936     //! \see    usb_api_callbacks
00937     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00938     virtual bool Attach( void ) = 0;
00939 
00940     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00941     //! \brief  Sets the device address using the last received SETUP packet.
00942     //! \details This method must only be called after a SET_ADDRESS standard request has
00943     //! been received. This is because it uses the last received SETUP packet stored
00944     //! in the sSetup structure to determine which address the device should use.
00945     //! \see    EnumStandardDeviceRequests
00946     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00947     virtual void SetAddress( void ) = 0;
00948 
00949     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00950     //! \brief  Sets the device configuration using the last received SETUP packet.
00951     //! \details This method must only be called after a SET_CONFIGURATION standard request
00952     //! has been received. This is necessary because it uses the last received
00953     //! SETUP packet (stored in the sSetup structure) to determine which
00954     //! configuration it should adopt.
00955     //! \see    EnumStandardDeviceRequests
00956     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00957     virtual void SetConfiguration( void ) = 0;
00958 
00959     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00960     //! \brief  Event handler for the USB controller peripheral.
00961     //! \details This function handles low-level events comming from the USB controller
00962     //! peripheral. It then dispatches those events through the user-provided
00963     //! callbacks. The following callbacks can be triggered:
00964     //!   -#  CEventSink::OnReset
00965     //!   -#  CEventSink::OnSuspend
00966     //!   -#  CEventSink::OnResume
00967     //!   -#  CEventSink::OnNewRequest
00968     //! \see usb_api_callbacks
00969     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00970     virtual void EventHandler( void ) = 0;
00971 
00972     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00973     //! \brief  Connects the device to the USB.
00974     //! \details This method enables the pull-up resistor on the D+ line, notifying the 
00975     //! host that the device wishes to connect to the bus.
00976     //! \see   CUsbDriver::Disconnect
00977     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00978     virtual void Connect( void ) = 0;
00979 
00980     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00981     //! \brief  Disconnects the device from the USB.
00982     //! This method disables the pull-up resistor on the D+ line, notifying the host
00983     //! that the device wishes to disconnect from the bus.
00984     //! \see   CUsbDriver::Connect
00985     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00986     virtual void Disconnect( void ) = 0;
00987 
00988 public:
00989     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00990     //       Public Methods
00991     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00992     
00993     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00994     //! \brief  Link device driver to CEventSink instance so CUsbDriver methods
00995     //!         could send callbacks properly.
00996     //! \return Pointer to the CEventSink instance
00997     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00998     void LinkTo( CEventSink* pArgEventSink, CBoard* pArgBoard )
00999     {
01000         pEventSink = pArgEventSink;
01001         pBoard = pArgBoard;
01002     }
01003 
01004     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01005     //! \brief  Returns a pointer to the last received SETUP request
01006     //! \return Pointer to the last received SETUP request
01007     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01008     S_usb_request* GetSetup( void )
01009     {
01010         return &sSetup;
01011     }
01012 
01013     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01014     //! \brief  Poll the status of flags in dStatus register
01015     //! \return bool  true if flag(s) is/are set
01016     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01017     bool IsStateSet( uint flags ) const
01018     {
01019         return ( dState & flags ) == flags;
01020     }
01021     
01022     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01023     //! \brief  Poll the status of flag(s) in dStatus register
01024     //! \return bool  true if flag(s) is/are cleared
01025     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01026     bool IsStateCleared( uint flags ) const
01027     {
01028         return ( dState & flags ) == 0;
01029     }
01030     
01031     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01032     //! \brief  Returns a number of configured endpoints
01033     //! \return uint   number of configured endpoints
01034     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01035     int GetNumEndpoints( void ) const
01036     {
01037         return dNumEndpoints;
01038     }
01039 
01040     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01041     //! \brief  Establish the list of configured endpoints
01042     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01043     void SetEndpointList( CEndpoint* list, int count )
01044     {
01045         pEndpoints     = list;
01046         dNumEndpoints  = count;
01047     }
01048 
01049     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01050     //! \brief  Sends a Zero-Length Packet (ZLP) through the Control endpoint 0.
01051     //! \details Since sending a ZLP on endpoint 0 is quite common, this function is 
01052     //! provided as an overload to the CUsbDriver::Write function.
01053     //! \param  fCallback Optional callback function to invoke when the transfer
01054     //!                   finishes
01055     //! \param  pArgument Optional parameter to pass to the callback function
01056     //! \return Result of operation
01057     //! \see    EnumStandardReturnValue
01058     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01059     EnumStandardReturnValue SendZLP0( Callback_f fCallback = 0, void* pArgument = 0 ) 
01060     {
01061         return Write( 0, 0, 0, fCallback, pArgument );
01062     }
01063 };
01064 
01065 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01066 //      Macros
01067 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01068 
01069 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01070 //      Structures and Classes
01071 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01072 
01073 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01074 //! \brief   List of standard descriptors used by the device
01075 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01076 struct S_std_descriptors
01077 {
01078     const S_usb_device_descriptor*        pDevice;        //!< Device descriptor
01079     const S_usb_configuration_descriptor* pConfiguration; //!< Configuration descriptor
01080     const char**                          pStrings;       //!< List of string descriptors
01081     const S_usb_endpoint_descriptor**     pEndpoints;     //!< List of endpoint descriptors
01082     
01083 #if defined(HIGHSPEED)
01084     //!< Qualifier descriptor (high-speed only)
01085     const S_usb_device_qualifier_descriptor* pQualifier; 
01086     //!< Other speed configuration descriptor (high-speed only)
01087     const S_usb_configuration_descriptor*    pOtherSpeedConfiguration; 
01088 #endif
01089 };
01090 
01091 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01092 //! \brief   USB standard class driver structure.
01093 //! \details Used to provide standard driver information so external modules can
01094 //!          still access an internal driver.
01095 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01096 class CSTD
01097 {
01098     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01099     //! wDeviceStatus flags: Information Returned by a GetStatus() Request to a Device.
01100     //! \see_usb20 - Section 9.4.5 - Figure 9-4
01101     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01102     enum // wDeviceStatus flags
01103     {
01104         SELF_POWERED          = (1 << 0),
01105         REMOTE_WAKEUP         = (1 << 1)
01106     };
01107 
01108 protected:
01109 
01110     CUsbDriver*              pDriver;       //!< Pointer to usb driver instance
01111     const S_std_descriptors* pDescriptors;  //!< Pointer to the list of descriptors 
01112                                             //!< used by the device
01113     ushort                   wDeviceStatus; //!< Data buffer used for information returned 
01114                                             //!< by a GetStatus() request to a Device
01115                                             //!< \see_usb20 Figure 9-4
01116     ushort                   wData;         //!< Temporary data buffer used by
01117                                             //!< pDriver->Write()
01118 
01119 private:
01120     
01121     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01122     //! \brief  Callback for the SetAddress usb request.
01123     //! \see    CSTD::RequestHandler
01124     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01125     static void OnSetAddress( CSTD* pThis )
01126     {
01127         pThis->pDriver->SetAddress ();
01128     }
01129 
01130     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01131     //! \brief  Configures the device and the endpoints
01132     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01133     void ConfigureEndpoints( void )
01134     {
01135         // Enter the Configured state
01136         //
01137         pDriver->SetConfiguration ();
01138 
01139         // Configure endpoints
01140         // TODO: Why this works for GetNumEndpoints()-1 and not
01141         // for GetNumEndpoints() when windows is getting out stand-by mode?
01142         //
01143         for ( int i = 0; i < pDriver->GetNumEndpoints () - 1; i++ )
01144         {
01145             pDriver->ConfigureEndpoint( pDescriptors->pEndpoints[ i ] );
01146         }
01147     }
01148 
01149     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01150     //! \brief  Callback for the SetConfiguration usb request.
01151     //!         Configures the device and the endpoints
01152     //! \see    CSTD::SetConfiguration, CSTD::ConfigureEndpoints
01153     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01154     static void OnConfigureEndpoints( CSTD* pThis )
01155     {
01156         pThis->ConfigureEndpoints ();
01157     }
01158     
01159     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01160     //! \brief  Sends a zero-length packet and starts the configuration procedure.
01161     //! \param  bConfiguration  Newly selected configuration
01162     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01163     void SetConfiguration( int bConfiguration )
01164     {
01165         pDriver->SendZLP0( Callback_f( OnConfigureEndpoints ), this );
01166     }
01167 
01168     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01169     //! \brief  Sends the currently selected configuration to the host.
01170     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01171     void GetConfiguration( void )
01172     {
01173         wData = pDriver->IsStateSet( USB_STATE_CONFIGURED ) ? 1 : 0; 
01174         pDriver->Write( 0, &wData, 1 );
01175     }
01176 
01177     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01178     //! \brief  Sends the current device status to the host.
01179     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01180     void GetDeviceStatus( void )
01181     {
01182         // Bus or self-powered ?
01183         //
01184         if ( ISSET( pDescriptors->pConfiguration->bmAttibutes, USB_CONFIG_SELF_POWERED ) ) 
01185         {
01186             wDeviceStatus |= SELF_POWERED;   // Self powered device
01187         }
01188         else 
01189         {
01190             wDeviceStatus &= ~SELF_POWERED;  // Bus powered device
01191         }
01192 
01193         // Return the device status
01194         //
01195         pDriver->Write( 0, &wDeviceStatus, 2 );
01196     }
01197 
01198     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01199     //! \brief  Sends the current status of specified endpoint to the host.
01200     //! \param  bEndpoint Endpoint number
01201     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01202     void GetEndpointStatus( int bEndpoint )
01203     {
01204         // Retrieve the endpoint current status
01205         //
01206         wData = ushort( pDriver->Halt( bEndpoint, USB_GET_STATUS ) );
01207 
01208         // Return the endpoint status
01209         //
01210         pDriver->Write( 0, &wData, 2 );
01211     }
01212 
01213     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01214     //! \brief  Sends the device descriptor to the host.
01215     //! \details The number of bytes actually sent depends on both the length
01216     //! requested by the host and the actual length of the descriptor.
01217     //! \param  wLength Number of bytes requested by the host
01218     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01219     void GetDeviceDescriptor( ushort wLength )
01220     {
01221         pDriver->Write
01222         ( 
01223             0, // endpoint
01224             pDescriptors->pDevice, // ptr to data
01225             min( sizeof(S_usb_device_descriptor), wLength ) // data length
01226             );
01227     }
01228 
01229     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01230     //! \brief  Sends the configuration descriptor to the host.
01231     //! \details The number of bytes actually sent depends on both the length
01232     //! requested by the host and the actual length of the descriptor.
01233     //! \param  wLength Number of bytes requested by the host
01234     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01235     void GetConfigurationDescriptor( ushort wLength )
01236     {
01237         pDriver->Write
01238         (
01239              0, // endpoint
01240              pDescriptors->pConfiguration, // ptr to data
01241              min( pDescriptors->pConfiguration->wTotalLength, wLength ) // data length
01242              );
01243     }
01244 
01245     #if defined(HIGHSPEED)
01246     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01247     //! \brief  Sends the qualifier descriptor to the host.
01248     //! \details The number of bytes actually sent depends on both the length
01249     //! requested by the host and the actual length of the descriptor.
01250     //! \param  wLength Number of bytes requested by the host
01251     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01252     void GetQualifierDescriptor( ushort wLength )
01253     {
01254         pDriver->Write
01255         (
01256             0, // endpoint
01257             pDescriptors->pQualifier, // ptr to data
01258             min( pDescriptors->pQualifier->bLength, wLength ) // data length
01259             );
01260     }
01261 
01262     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01263     //! \brief  Sends the other speed configuration descriptor to the host.
01264     //! \details The number of bytes actually sent depends on both the length
01265     //! requested by the host and the actual length of the descriptor.
01266     //! \param  wLength Number of bytes requested by the host
01267     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01268     void GetOSCDescriptor( ushort wLength )
01269     {
01270         pDriver->Write
01271         (
01272              0, // end point
01273              pDescriptors->pOtherSpeedConfiguration, // ptr to data
01274              min( pDescriptors->pOtherSpeedConfiguration->wTotalLength, wLength ) // len
01275              );
01276     }
01277     #endif
01278 
01279     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01280     //! \brief  Sends the specified string descriptor to the host
01281     //! \details The number of bytes actually sent depends on both the length
01282     //! requested by the host and the actual length of the descriptor.
01283     //! \param  wLength Number of bytes requested by the host
01284     //! \param  bIndex  Index of requested string descriptor
01285     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01286     void GetStringDescriptor( ushort wLength, int bIndex )
01287     {
01288         pDriver->Write
01289         (
01290             0, // endpoint
01291             pDescriptors->pStrings[ bIndex ], // ptr to data
01292             min( *pDescriptors->pStrings[ bIndex ], wLength ) // data length
01293             );
01294     }
01295     
01296 protected:
01297 
01298     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01299     //! \brief  Handles standard SETUP requests
01300     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01301     virtual void RequestHandler( void );
01302 
01303     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01304     //! \brief  Constructor. Connects object to CUsbDriver instance.
01305     //! \details Note that this constructor is not public, which means that CSTD objects 
01306     //! can not be instantiated. However, derived class objects could be instantiated 
01307     //! normally.
01308     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01309     CSTD( CUsbDriver* usbDriver, CBoard* board, CEventSink* eventSink )
01310     {
01311         pDriver = usbDriver;
01312         pDriver->LinkTo( eventSink, board );
01313     }
01314 
01315 public:
01316 
01317     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01318     //! \brief  Low-level usb driver interrupt handler
01319     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01320     void EventHandler( void )
01321     {
01322         pDriver->EventHandler ();
01323     }
01324 
01325     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01326     //! \brief  Initializes the USB API and the USB controller.
01327     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01328     void Init( void )
01329     {
01330         pDriver->Init ();
01331     }
01332 
01333     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01334     //! \brief  Return true if device is powered 
01335     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01336     bool IsPowered( void ) const
01337     {
01338         return pDriver->IsStateSet( USB_STATE_POWERED );
01339     }
01340 
01341     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01342     //! \brief  Connect to device. 
01343     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01344     void Connect( void )
01345     {
01346         pDriver->Connect ();
01347     }
01348 
01349     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01350     //! \brief  Attach device to USB bus. 
01351     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01352     void Attach( void )
01353     {
01354         pDriver->Attach ();
01355     }
01356 };
01357 
01358 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01359 //      Exported symbols
01360 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01361 
01362 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01363 //! Default USB driver for the current chip
01364 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01365 extern CUsbDriver& sDefaultUsbDriver;
01366 
01367 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01368 } // namespace USB
01369 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01370 
01371 #endif // _USB_FRAMEWORK_H_INCLUDED
